The use case aims to show a basic example of how to get the first day and last day of the previous month

Last Updated: 2022-01-04

The output for the entire workflow

(Screenshot of the output for the Use Case flow)

Overview on the whole workflow

(Image of the Overview for the whole process of getting first and last day of the previous month)

Setting up Microsoft List

There is a need to create a new list to store the output of the data. There is two columns needed which are First Day Of The Previous Month and Last Day Of The Previous Month

(Screenshot of the columns in Microsoft list)

Initialize Variable

First, add a new action Initialize Variable with the expression

startOfMonth(getPastTime(1,'Month'),'MM/dd/yyyy')

This gives the first day of the previous month

(Screenshot showing the input for Initialize variable)

Initialize Variable 2

Next, create a new action Initialize Variable with the expression

subtractFromTime(startOfMonth(utcNow(),'MM/dd/yyyy'),1,'day')

(Screenshot showing the input for Initialize variable 2)

Create Item

Lastly, create a new action Create Item and select the list used to store the date time.For the First Day Of Previous Month, input the expression

formatDateTime(variables('ToGetFirstDayOfLastMonth'),'yyyy-MM-dd') which formats the date.

Last Day Of The Previous Month, input the expression

formatDateTime(variables('ToGetLastDayOfLastMonth'),'yyyy-MM-dd')

(Screenshot showing the inputs for Create Item)

https://debajmecrm.com/how-to-get-last-day-of-current-month-in-power-automate/
